## [Synthesis Research]{.light-green} {.smaller}

![NCEAS logo](lter_images/logo-nceas.png){.absolute top=-30 left=820 width="12%"}
![LTER logo](lter_images/logo-lter.png){.absolute top=-21 left=950 width="10%"}

- How do we define "synthesis"?

. . .

> **Synthesis** brings together the results of [**multiple studies**]{.dark-green} to test [**novel hypotheses**]{.dark-blue}

\

. . .

- LTER research is hypothesis-driven
    -  Means _many_ different data are collected

\

. . .

- Perfect context for innovative synthesis work!

## [Working Groups & ECRs]{.light-green} {.smaller}

![NCEAS logo](lter_images/logo-nceas.png){.absolute top=-30 left=820 width="12%"}
![LTER logo](lter_images/logo-lter.png){.absolute top=-21 left=950 width="10%"}

- <u>Most</u> groups include early career researchers (ECRs)
    - Typically graduate students and post-docs
    - Sometimes even undergraduates!

\

. . .

- ECRs get a _ton_ out of participating
    - Networking, leadership opportunities, publications, job opportunities, etc.

\

. . .

- Groups get a lot out of including ECRs as well!
    - Novel analytical methods, new perspectives, coding literacy

## [ECRs & Synthesis Training]{.light-green} {.smaller}

![NCEAS logo](lter_images/logo-nceas.png){.absolute top=-30 left=820 width="12%"}
![LTER logo](lter_images/logo-lter.png){.absolute top=-21 left=950 width="10%"}

- ECR demand for synthesis training **_far_** outstrips working group capacity

\

. . .

- Inspired development of a course to provide these skills
    - <u>S</u>ynthesis <u>S</u>kills for <u>E</u>arly <u>C</u>areer <u>R</u>esearchers (SSECR)

\

. . .

- SSECR aims to train ECRs in needed quantitative _and_ inclusive facilitation skills

\

. . .

- Timed to leave students well prepared to apply for SPARC group funding

## [Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion]{.light-green} {.smaller}

![NCEAS logo](lter_images/logo-nceas.png){.absolute top=-30 left=820 width="12%"}
![LTER logo](lter_images/logo-lter.png){.absolute top=-21 left=950 width="10%"}

- The network has two primary justice goals heading into our next funding cycle:

. . .

1. Greater cultural, socioeconomic, and gender diversity throughout the LTER network

. . .

2. More rapid and innovative synthesis

\
\

. . .

- SSECR is built--in part--to support these goals

## [SSECR Goals]{.dark-green}

![NCEAS logo](lter_images/logo-nceas.png){.absolute top=-30 left=820 width="12%"}
![LTER logo](lter_images/logo-lter.png){.absolute top=-21 left=950 width="10%"}

- We have the following strategic goals for the course:

:::{.incremental}

1. Surface and test new synthesis ideas for feasibility
2. Prepare more ECRs to be synthesis project leaders
3. Connect LTER-affiliated ECRs across sites
4. Develop intergenerational linkages around synthesis

:::

## [Target Audience]{.dark-green} {.smaller}

![NCEAS logo](lter_images/logo-nceas.png){.absolute top=-30 left=820 width="12%"}
![LTER logo](lter_images/logo-lter.png){.absolute top=-21 left=950 width="10%"}

- We're looking to recruit graduate students actively working at/with LTER sites

\

. . . 

- \~30 students per cohort (about 1 per LTER site)

\

. . . 

- Ideally have some primary research experience
    - <u>No requirement</u> for prior _synthesis_ experience

\

. . . 

- Estimated time commitment is 3 hours per week
    - Products of [student projects]{.dark-blue} hopefully persuasive to PIs / graduate committees

## [Course Logistics]{.dark-green} {.smaller}

![NCEAS logo](lter_images/logo-nceas.png){.absolute top=-30 left=820 width="12%"}
![LTER logo](lter_images/logo-lter.png){.absolute top=-21 left=950 width="10%"}

- Course runs for 9 months (Sept - May)

\

. . . 

- First full week in-person at NCEAS
    - Facilitate cohort sense of community
    - Students form groups of 5-6 with interest in shared project idea

\

. . .

- Biweekly synchronous virtual meetings
    - In "off" weeks groups meet together / with project mentors

## [Team Science Emphasis]{.dark-green}

![NCEAS logo](lter_images/logo-nceas.png){.absolute top=-30 left=820 width="12%"}
![LTER logo](lter_images/logo-lter.png){.absolute top=-21 left=950 width="10%"}


- Synthesis work _requires_ meaningful teamwork

\

. . .

- Modules focus on these "soft skills"
    - Consistent inclusivity angle to modules in this category

\

. . .

- Many of these skills are particularly absent from graduate school curricula

## [Quantitative Emphasis]{.dark-green}

![NCEAS logo](lter_images/logo-nceas.png){.absolute top=-30 left=820 width="12%"}
![LTER logo](lter_images/logo-lter.png){.absolute top=-21 left=950 width="10%"}

- Synthesis work usually has **significant** quantitative needs

\

. . .

- Extensive harmonizing often pre-requisite to the most fundamental exploration

\

. . .

- Quality control requires an in-depth examination of _each_ primary project's metadata

## [Projects Overview]{.dark-blue} {.smaller}

![NCEAS logo](lter_images/logo-nceas.png){.absolute top=-30 left=820 width="12%"}
![LTER logo](lter_images/logo-lter.png){.absolute top=-21 left=950 width="10%"}

- Students will work on projects outside of class sessions with their peers

\

- Projects offer a real world context to apply the content covered in modules

\

- Deliverables produced by project teams will be valuable entries in student portfolios
    - Dissertation/thesis chapters
    - Published papers
    - Data packages & software
    - Websites
    - SPARC group / working group / other grant application fodder

## [Project Mentors]{.dark-blue} {.smaller}

![NCEAS logo](lter_images/logo-nceas.png){.absolute top=-30 left=820 width="12%"}
![LTER logo](lter_images/logo-lter.png){.absolute top=-21 left=950 width="10%"}

- Each project group will be paired with a discipline-relevant mentor with synthesis experience

\

- Groups and mentors meet at least 5 times throughout the course

\

- Content and structure of those meetings is up to those involved
    - Suggesting readings or collaborators
    - Discussing analytical approaches
    - Sharing prior and current experience
